alert.note: Alert for Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued September 24 at 7:05PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY... WHAT...Surf of 15 to 18 feet WHERE...East and south shores WHEN...Through Monday IMPACTS...Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore and potentially deadly rip currents. Some strong coastal erosion is likely. Very large waves may bring some ocean debris onto roadways, impact small harbors, and make navigating the harbor channel dangerous. Lapataiga mo galu matua maualuluga Ofisa o le tau Pago Pago AS 705 PO ASO SA SETEMA 24 2023 ...O LOO TUMAU LAPATAIGA MO GALU MAUALULUGA E OO I LE ASO GAFUA... MAFUAAGA...O galu e 15 i le 18 futu NOFOAGA...talafatai i sasa`e ma saute TAIMI...Se`ia oo i le Aso Gafua AAFIAGA...Aafiaga FEOLOLO mai Lapataiga o Galu Maualuluga...E ono fafati malosi galu ma malosi aave o le sami. E ono iai sologa i gataifale ma e ono aumai galu maualuluga otaota o le sami i luga o auala. E aafia ai uafu laiti ma faafaigata ai ona folau vaa i le ava o le uafu. FAUTUAGA/TAPENAGA... Sauniuniga mo Lapataiga o Galu Maualuluga tulaga FEOLOLO... E ono lolovaia nofoaga o loo latalata i gataifale. E ono tapunia auala o nofoaga maualalo aua faaputuga vai o le sami. Faalogologo pea mo ni faamatalaga mo auala ua tapuni ma nofoaga matala e ono sulufai ai. E ono tafea se tasi o loo iai i nofoaga maualalo i le sami ma e ono faaumatia ai ola.
info.instruction: Residents in vulnerable locations may experience flooding. Some roads in vulnerable, low-lying areas may be closed from floodwaters. Stay tuned to local officials for any road closures or evacuations. Anyone in low-lying and vulnerable areas could be swept out to sea and face significant injury or death.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
